thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits Monaco wonder kid Kylian Mbappe snubbed Arsenal move last summer
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits Monaco wonder kid Kylian Mbappe snubbed Arsenal move last summer

author: whaughton
title: Arsene Wenger admits Monaco wonder kid Kylian Mbappe snubbed Arsenal move last summer
text:
Knocked Mbappe Arsene Wenger admits Monaco wonder kid Kylian Mbappe snubbed Arsenal move last summer 
Monaco teenager is one of the hottest talents in Europe and being compared to Arsenal legend Thierry Henry by Warren Haughton Comments ARSENAL boss Arsene Wenger has confirmed he tried to sign Monaco wonder kid Kylian Mbappe. 
The French teenager has been dubbed the new ‘Thierry Henry’ and is one of the hottest young talents in Europe. Getty Images 4 Arsene Wenger has confirmed Monaco kid Kylian Mbappé turned down Arsenal last summer 
Speaking ahead of the tomorrow’s crunch game against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge, the Gunners boss revealed the kid turned down the chance to move to the Emirates last summer. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Wenger said:”He has similarities to Thierry, has huge talent, plays for Monaco like Thierry. But after that what makes a career is the mental aspect Thierry had, this young boy has to show that now,we wanted him last season but he decided to stay where he was.” Getty Images Arsene Wenger is still tracking Monaco teenager Kylian Mbappe Reuters Kylian Mbappe is the new hot name in European football AP:Associated Press Kylian Mbappé has had a similar rise up the ranks at Monaco to Thierry Henry related stories we'll be ready Angry Arsenal will be ready to put things right after Watford disaster, Arsene Wenger warns Chelsea RAM BLOW Aaron Ramsey to be sidelined for at least THREE WEEKS with calf injury he picked up in Arsenal's loss to Watford Wenger's Blue day Arsene Wenger to be surrounded by security in Stamford Bridge stand for crunch Chelsea clash NEIL ASHTON Arsenal are no longer the nearly men, they are the nowhere men with a culture of mediocrity and money 'Arsenal gave me everything' Chelsea ace Cesc Fabregas hails Arsene Wenger as he prepares to take on old club on Saturday 
Mbappe has followed a nearly-identical rise in France as Henry as they both grew up in Paris before being scouted to play at the Clairefontaine Academy. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Chelsea v Arsenal 
At age 16, Mbappe made his Ligue 1 debut and then became Monaco's youngest ever goalscorer - breaking Henry's longstanding record - when he netted against Troyes aged 17 and two months. 
Monaco handed Mbappe a professional contract last season and has three goals and five assists in the league this term.
